brief_summary.textblock:
The study was done to evaluate the effects of the follicular and luteal phases of the
      menstrual cycle on sedation level at loss of consciousness and bispectral index reach to 50
      during propofol anesthesia, in patients with and without preoperative intravenous
      dexmedetomidine .

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Dexmedetomidine on Bispectral Index and Propofol Requirements During Different Menstrual Cycle

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  a regular menstrual cycle

          -  elective gynecologic surgery

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  pregnancy

          -  breastfeeding

          -  obesity

          -  known hypersensitivity to drugs used in the study protocol;

          -  use of psychotropic drugs and steroids within 72 hours before the surgery

          -  central nervous system injury

          -  renal impairment

          -  alcoholism and opioid addiction.

clinical_study.keyword: Bispectral Index Monitor, Menstrual Cycle, Dexmedetomidine
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Dexmedetomidine on Bispectral Index and Propofol Requirements During Different Menstrual Cycle

other_outcome.measure: duration from propofol administered to loss of eyelash reflex and bispectral index reduced to 50

primary_outcome.measure: bispectral index at loss of eyelash reflex

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: propofol requirements from propofol administered to loss of eyelash reflex and bispectral index reduced to 50

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator), Primary Purpose: Prevention
